level.heading: Misdemeanor sexual abuse.
level.text: Whoever engages in a sexual act or sexual contact with another person and who should have knowledge or reason to know that the act was committed without that other person's permission, shall be imprisoned for not more than 180 days and, in addition, may be fined in an amount not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01.

level.heading: Cross References
level.text: Consent defense to sexual abuse, see § 22-3007.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 16-801, § 22-4151, and § 23-581.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 substituted "not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01" for "in an amount not to exceed $1,000".

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 232(e) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 10-257
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 10-257, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 22-3001.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
